title: Two Trains Running, touring, review: a powerful, still-relevant snapshot of the socially turbulent Sixties
text:
August Wilson (1945-2005) was a giant of the American stage, a giant with his feet planted on one patch of urban terrain, the Hill District of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where he was born in 1945. He focused with unfading devotion on its African-American community and evaluated its changing fortunes across the 20th century in a series of 10 plays, known as “the Pittsburgh Cycle”.

Although the cycle has been staged in its entirety several times in America, the presentation of his magnum opus in the UK has only been piecemeal.
